title: Chandrayaan-3 Reaches Lunar Orbit, Landing Soon with Russia, Japan and U.S. Close Behind
summary: India’s Chandrayaan-3 reached lunar orbit today enroute to a landing in less than three weeks. It is the country’s second attempt to land on the Moon. The success rate for […]

title: After 11 years on Mars, Curiosity continues to climb the slopes of Mount Sharp
summary: On Aug. 6, 2012, NASA’s Mars Science Laboratory mission, comprised of the new Curiosity rover, officially began when Curiosity was successfully lowered onto the Martian surface via a first-of-its-kind skycrane. Curiosity‘s landing location was at the base of Mount Sharp (officially referred to as Aeolis Mons) in Gale Crater — a 3.5 billion-year-old crater that scientists believe was once a lake.

title: NASA, ESA, CSA, and JAXA Commit To ISS Operations Through 2030
summary: NASA and its three Western partners, Canada, Europe, and Japan, confirmed plans to extend ISS operations through 2030 during a recent panel session at the International Space Station Research and Development Conference.

title: ISRO Chandrayaan-3 Lunar Orbit Confirmed
summary: India is gearing up for its second lunar landing attempt as the Chandrayaan-3 spacecraft successfully arrived in lunar orbit.

title: India’s Chandrayaan-3 lander arrives in lunar orbit
summary: India will make its second moon landing attempt in 18 days’ time after its Chandrayaan-3 spacecraft arrived in lunar orbit Saturday.

title: Astra lays off, reassigns employees as it refocuses on satellite propulsion
summary: Astra Space announced Aug. 4 it has laid off a quarter of its workforce and reassigned others from launch vehicle to satellite propulsion development as its cash reserves dwindle.

title: A look at the surprising history of the earliest rocket pioneers
summary: A review of the book From the Earth to Mars.

title: SpaceX to launch 22 Starlink satellites this week
summary: 22 more V2 mini Starlink satellites are set to launch atop a Falcon 9 on Sunday, August 6th. The launch is currently...

title: Apple-backed Globalstar’s revenue jump underlines IoT opportunity
summary: Globalstar, the operator behind Apple’s satellite-enabled SOS app, posted a 50% year-on-year jump in quarterly sales Aug. 3 amid promising growth in its business for connecting remote Internet of Things devices.

title: Astra conducts layoffs, raises debt and shifts focus to spacecraft engines in bid to survive
summary: Struggling space company Astra is cutting 25% of its workforce, the company announced on Friday, and restructuring to focus more on its spacecraft engine business, which will delay progress on the small rocket it has been developing.
